org.rapla.entities.domain

Interface Allocatable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Annotatable, Classifiable, Cloneable, Entity<Allocatable>, EntityPermissionContainer<Allocatable>, LastChangedTimestamp, Named, Ownable, PermissionContainer, RaplaObject<Allocatable>, Timestamp

    public interface Allocatable
extends EntityPermissionContainer<Allocatable>, Named, Classifiable, Ownable, Timestamp, Annotatable
    Objects that implement allocatable can be allocated by reservations.
    See Also:
    Reservation

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.rapla.entities.domain.PermissionContainer

      • TYPE

        static final RaplaType<Allocatable> TYPE

      • ALLOCATABLE_ARRAY

        static final Allocatable[] ALLOCATABLE_ARRAY
        Static empty dummy Array. Mainly for using the toArray() method of the collection interface

    • Method Detail

      • isHoldBackConflicts

        @Deprecated
boolean isHoldBackConflicts()
        Deprecated. use getAnnotation(IGNORE_CONFLICTS) instead
        Conflicts for this allocatable should be ignored, if this flag is enabled.

      • canAllocate

        boolean canAllocate(User user,
                    Date start,
                    Date end,
                    Date today)
        returns if the user has the permission to allocate the resource in the given time. It returns true if for at least one permission calling permission.covers() and permission.affectsUser yields true.

      • canAllocate

        boolean canAllocate(User user,
                    Date today)
        returns if the user has the permission to allocate the resource in at a time in the future without specifying the exact time

      • getPermissions

        @Deprecated
Permission[] getPermissions()
        Deprecated. use getPermissionList instead

      • canRead

        boolean canRead(User user)

      • canModify

        boolean canModify(User user)

      • canReadOnlyInformation

        boolean canReadOnlyInformation(User user)

      • getAllocateInterval

        TimeInterval getAllocateInterval(User user,
                                 Date today)
        returns the interval in which the user can allocate the resource. Returns null if the user can't allocate the resource

      • canCreateConflicts

        boolean canCreateConflicts(User user)
        returns if the user has the permission to create a conflict for the resource.

      • isPerson

        boolean isPerson()
        same as DynamicTypeAnnotations.VALUE_CLASSIFICATION_TYPE_PERSON.equals(allocatable.getType().getAnnotation(DynamicTypeAnnotations.KEY_CLASSIFICATION_TYPE))
